greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct Sophie Germain prime factors of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{p|n} (pi(2p+1) - pi(2p)), where p is a prime and pi(k) = A000720(k). - _Ridouane Oudra_, Aug 25 2019
maple: with(numtheory): seq(add(pi(2*i+1)-pi(2*i), i in factorset(n)), n=1..100); # _Ridouane Oudra_, Aug 25 2019
program: (MAGMA) [0] cat [&+[#PrimesInInterval(2*p,2*p+1):p in PrimeDivisors(n)]:n in [2..100]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Aug 25 2019
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 10 2009
